did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Publicity, reviews, and fan responses to the movie "Go Fish", and Turner's sketchbook with art for the movie's credits. Includes press packets for its international releases.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Guinevere Turner starred in the 1994 movie "Go Fish" and also was a writer and producer. She was a writer and story editor for the first two seasons of the television series The L Word and appeared in it as the character Gabby Deveaux. Born in Boston, Massachusetts on May 23, 1968, her career has included being the screenwriter of American Psycho and The Notorious Bettie Page and playing the lead role of the dominatrix Tanya Cheex in Preaching to the Perverted. She has also directed several short films, such as The Hummer (2003) and Hung (2005), which have appeared in many international film festivals. In 2014 she appeared in the horror comedy film Crazy Bitches.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Publicity, reviews, and fan responses to the movie "Go Fish", and Turner's sketchbook with art for the movie's credits. Includes press packets for its international releases.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:

scopecontent.p: Contains article "Slippery When Wet: Go Fish and Other Lesbian Fish Films"
Contains article "Fish Stories: Holly Willis on Go Fish." Also includes mentions of the film in summaries of various film festivals

scopecontent.p: Includes brief write-up for Go Fish and a half-page ad for it.
